format: A data frame with 26217 observations on the following 15 variables.

parameters.airbag: a factor with levels none airbag
parameters.deploy:
a numeric vector: 0 if an airbag was
unavailable or did not deploy; 1 if one or more bags deployed.
parameters.caseid:
character, created by pasting together the
populations sampling unit, the case number, and the vehicle
number.  Within each year, use this to uniquely identify the
vehicle.
parameters.injSeverity:
a numeric vector; 0:none, 1:possible injury,
2:no incapacity, 3:incapacity, 4:killed; 5:unknown, 6:prior death
parameters.abcat:
Did one or more (driver or passenger) airbag(s)
deploy? This factor has levels deploy nodeploy
unavail
parameters.sex: a factor with levels f m
parameters.occRole: a factor with levels driver pass
parameters.weight:
Observation weights, albeit of uncertain
accuracy, designed to account for varying sampling probabilities.
parameters.dvcat:
ordered factor with levels (estimated impact
speeds) 1-9km/h, 10-24, 25-39, 40-54,
55+
parameters.seatbelt: a factor with levels none belted
parameters.yearVeh: Year of model of vehicle; a numeric vector

title: Airbag and other influences on accident fatalities
description:
Description
US data, for 1997-2002, from police-reported car crashes in
which there is a harmful event (people or property), and from which at
least one vehicle was towed. Data are restricted to front-seat
occupants, include only a subset of the variables recorded, and
are restricted in other ways also.
reference:
Data collection used a multi-stage probabilistic sampling scheme.
The observation weight, called national inflation factor
(national) in the data from NASS, is the inverse
of an estimate of the selection probability.  These data
include a subset of the variables from the NASS dataset.  Variables
that are coded here as factors are coded as numeric values in that
dataset.
